LAID THE FOUNDATIONS.Definition: to produce the basic ideas or structures from which something much larger develops

THE FABRIC OF STH.Definition: the structure or parts of something

STINT.Definition: a fixed or limited period of time spent doing a particular job or activity

INFLATION.Definition: a general, continuous increase in prices

TRADE UNIONS.Definition: an organisation that represents the people who work in a particular industry, protects their rights, and discusses their pay and working conditions with employers

NEOLIBERAL.Definition: supporting a large amount of freedom for markets, with little government control or spending, and low taxes

RELIANCE.Definition: the state of depending on or trusting in something or someone

ROOT CAUSE.Definition: the most important cause, the most important reason for something

OUTCOMES.Definition: a result or effect of an action, situation, etc.

PROSPERITY.Definition: the state of being successful and having a lot of money

ACROSS THE POND.Definition: the other side of the Atlantic Ocean

AGENDA.Definition: the things that a person or organisation considers to be important and wants to solve or achieve, or their reasons for wanting to do something

IMPLEMENTED.Definition: to start using a plan or system

HINTED AT.Definition: to say or do something that shows what you think or want, usually in a way that is not direct

NUTRIENTS.Definition: any substance that plants or animals need in order to live and grow

NUTRITIONAL.Definition: relating to nutrition, or containing a food substance your body can use

BACKLASH.Definition: a strong feeling among a group of people in reaction to a change or recent events in society or politics

NICKNAME.Definition: an informal name for someone or something, especially a name that you are called by your friends or family, usually based on your real name or your character

ASCENT.Definition: the act of climbing or moving upwards

MANDATE.Definition: the authority given to an elected group of people, such as a government, to perform an action or govern a country

COAL.Definition: a hard, black substance that is dug from the earth in pieces, and can be burned to produce heat or power, or a single piece of this

LEGACIES.Definition: a situation that has developed as a result of past actions and decisions

HARDSHIP.Definition: (something that causes) difficult or unpleasant conditions of life, or an example of this

UNPROFITABLE.Definition: not making a profit, losing money

BUDGE.Definition: If something will not budge or you cannot budge it, it will not move

DOZENS.Definition: twelve, a large but not exact number

DESPISED.Definition: to feel a strong dislike for someone or something because you think that that person or thing is bad or has no value

NEEDLESSLY.Definition: in a way that is not necessary

PROPPING UP.Definition: to lift and give support to something by putting something under it

MIXED.Definition: showing a mixture of different feelings or opinions

EMBARKED ON.Definition: to start something new or important

MORTGAGES.Definition: an agreement that allows you to borrow money from a bank or similar organisation, especially in order to buy a house, or the amount of money itself

HAVE YOUR (FAIR) SHARE OF STH.Definition: to have a lot or more than enough of something bad

DIEHARD.Definition: someone who is unwilling to change or give up their ideas or ways of behaving, even when there are good reasons to do so

RUN DEEP.Definition: If a feeling or problem runs deep, it is strong or serious and has existed for a long time

IMPLICATIONS.Definition: an occasion when you seem to suggest something without saying it directly

HEADLINE.Definition: a line of words printed in large letters as the title of a story in a newspaper, or the main points of the news that are broadcast on television or radio

REJOICE.Definition: to feel or show great happiness about something

PULLOUT.Definition: in a magazine or newspaper, a set of pages that are intended to be taken out and used separately

UNPACK.Definition: to explain or examine something in order to make its meaning clearer

FUNDAMENTALLY.Definition: in a basic and important way

FUNK.Definition: the state of being unhappy and without hope

SET THE STAGE.Definition: used to mean that conditions have been made right for something to happen, or that something is likely to happen

PHENOMENON.Definition: something that exists and can be seen, felt, tasted, etc., especially something unusual or interesting

DIVISIVE.Definition: used to describe something or someone that causes great and sometimes unfriendly disagreement within a group of people

HAVE THE MEASURE OF SB/STH.Definition: to understand what someone or something is like and to know how to deal with him, her, or it
